headline: He may be first on the path but he can't do the math

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: We're going to Mars. We're stopping at the moon. The moon is actually a launching pad. That's why we're stopping at the moon. I said, hey, we've already done the moon. That's so exciting. And I said, sir, I said, I want you to head for Mars. So we'll be doing the moon, but we will really be doing Mars.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: I could see it now. Mars-a-Lago.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, it's been another banner week for the media -- by banner, you mean stupid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They remind me of a nasty fly.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Every major-- that's a nasty fly. I don't like those suckers. I don't know about you in New Mexico, but I'm not into flies or mosquitoes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But who is really? Also, you know, I don't like snakes too much.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I don't like snakes too much. We have plenty of them in New York and Washington, a different variety. I don't like snakes either.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what? They're almost as bad as children.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I know a guy who can't stand his children. They are horrible, horrible human beings. They're a little older now. But they're horrible human beings. He wants to leave his well. They said why would you leave them? They don't even like you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Makes me think of the song "YMCA."

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Think of the song, "YMCA." Y-M-C-A. Think of the song.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We are, Mr. President, and why not? Everyone loves that song.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: The Republicans love it. And the Democrats love it. And frankly, labor loves it. Unions love it. Farmers love, love, love it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Which could be why everyone is looking so much better these days.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You look all much better than you did three years ago, even with the #MeToo Movement, we can't say this. But I'll say it anyway, you're better looking. Including the men.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Including the men, Terry. Not like those phony Democrats.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: How about these phony Democrats? They started with Russia, Russia, Russia. Then they went to race. Do you believe that one? Race? Then they went to recession. There is going to be a recession. Oh, please let there be a recession. Please.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: These are phony people. But that's okay.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: These are phony people. But that's okay. You know, when you think of it, I'm President and they're not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much, President Trump.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much, President Trump. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was an experiment to show you that [bleep] this is funny on its own. I don't even have to write a damn joke anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I just pick the best parts and repeat it. Which is great. It's less work for me. And he is way more entertaining than his critics in the media, who are getting more desperate every day. Things are pretty good, but they need people to believe it's pretty bad. So what did they do? They frantically try to reanimate the Kavanaugh story, right? "The New York Times" ran an excerpt from a book in which an alleged incident of sexual abuse was documented. And then it was on every show and every network until, whoops, it was revealed at "The Times," you know, they left out a key fact. The alleged victim had no recollection of any incident -- at all. Weird how that detail got past the editors? You'd think a detail like that would matter. But they knew the book and the story itself was a dud. So they obliterated that detail. And that was how they maintained their business model, which is to sell urban legends to people who feel the same way they do.   So they ran a story about a Supreme Court Justice committing a crime, leaving out the part about there not being a victim. Imagine that. That's a pretty big omission. I mean, that's like writing a book about great Americans and forgetting about me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, thank you. Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But that wasn't the only mistake the media made this week. One day, they're pushing false stats on hate crimes linking them to Trump rallies, which was then debunked by "Reason" magazine. Then on another day, they're running stories about Trump stealing pancakes in Scotland. I'm not kidding. That was an actual story. There was other crap too about Trump's family turmoil, but it all burned briefly and faded.  No wonder the media tried to revive the Kavanaugh smear. And as always, in trying to take down Trump, they deliberately warp the truth. I wonder if Trump agrees that this is one of the worst weeks in the history of the fake news media.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I think this is one of the worst weeks in the history of the fake news media. The media of our country is laughed at all over the world now. You're a joke.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're a joke. Ouch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So it is getting harder and harder each day to figure out what's real and what isn't out there in media land. If only there was a product for that.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: It's happening everywhere. In parks, in offices, and in homes all across America.

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, FOX NATION HOST
utterances.sentences: This is awful. Every time I read "The Times," I realize it's wrong or they've left out facts, then I have to waste time rereading the corrections. And I'm a centrist. It's ridiculous, and exhausting.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: It sounds like you could use some Correction Lenses.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: At this point, I'm going for anything. What are they?

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Correction lenses are an ocular enhancement that prevents your eyes from seeing all the inaccuracies in "The New York Times" reporting by removing everything except the truth. The result? You get only the facts.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Whoa. This is incredible. It's only the truth stuff. It is September 2019. And look, here is the word the, T-H-E. That's how you spell it. This is amazing. Do they work on anything else?

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Sure thing. Try watching CNN. That's right. Correction Lenses turn all CNN programming into "Tucker Carlson Tonight."

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Wow. This is the best invention ever. Thanks, Correction Lenses.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: So get Correction Lenses today. It's for people who love news, real news.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: It makes up for the fact that my wife won't talk to me.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. If GI Joe and Popeye had a love child, yes, it would be retired Green Beret Master Sergeant Terry Schappert.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She is always sunny and knows a lot about money, stock market guru and financial analyst, Heather Zumarraga.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She is small in stature, but sounds like Thatcher. Host of "Sincerely, Kat" on Fox Nation, Kat Timpf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And one day, he accidentally tripped on Guam. My massive sidekick and host of "Nuff Said" on Fox Nation, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Terry, Terry, so what do you make of the media performance this week?

utterances.speaker: TERRY SCHAPPERT, RETIRED GREEN BERET MASTER SERGEANT
utterances.sentences: Here's the problem. Trump is making you comedically lazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: You're getting comedically flabby because you don't have to write anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is true.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: And you know, I wish you'd put a little more effort, but you don't have to.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's so obvious that I didn't do the work this week.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Because okay A, I had jury duty.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: You were busy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I was in jury duty. I was sitting there for hours and then I was reading the transcript of Trumps words. I go, thank you.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: He gave it to you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He gave it to me.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: I just don't want you to lose the eye of the tiger, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I won't.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Okay, good. Also speaking of eyes, the glasses that's from my favorite movie, one of them, "They Live."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "They Live."

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: It never gets old. The media. Here's the thing, I heard a guy call on the radio other day on a show. I am not going say his name because he was a conservative thinker. And he said, you know, the problem is the media continues to bite on this. No, they're not biting on anything. They're creating it. Right? So I mean, and the thing is, they've just been busted. I still don't think they can recover from this. They just don't stop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you know what the thing is Heather, it's like I think the media has created a permanent jaded public. They're like a cheating spouse, you no longer buy their BS, right? Not that I would know. These are only analogies, people. Only analogies, Heather.

utterances.speaker: HEATHER ZUMARRAGA, FINANCIAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: What did they think? Oops, that's a big oops that they forgot. Miss Ramirez didn't even -- wasn't even interviewed and the supposed witness, Max Stier doesn't even recall the incident. Says she doesn't even recall the incident that they're attacking Judge Kavanaugh on? That's more than an oops.  So they made a retraction. I get it. They made the correction. But three Democratic Presidential candidates immediately, Senator Warren, Senator Harris, Beto O'Rourke immediately called for Kavanaugh's resignation. There's a problem with that. That's just wrong.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes. And then of course --

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: They didn't even verify any facts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And you know what, Kat? Nobody gets punished. Like is "New York Times" going to do anything about it? No, they just -- they let it move on until they find the next crisis which is the Ukrainian phone call, I guess.

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NATION HOST
utterances.sentences: Look, I mean, they issued a correction, all right.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Corrections can be very useful for things like we said that Bob was 41, he is really 42 or like we said that Sarah was from San Diego. She is really from San Jose. Or the woman who was allegedly assaulted does not remember, you know, saying -- no, obviously, using a correction for selling that -- however, I would like to shame "The New York Times" for something related.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And I have the receipts here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I will -- because you didn't touch on it. Maybe if you've been working a little harder you would have touched on this.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: He is lazy.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: But did you see the tweet? GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, CONTRIBUTOR: The man was in jury duty.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: This is the tweet that "The New York Times" tweeted out ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: ... to promote this story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: It said, having a [bleep] thrust in your face at a drunken dorm party may seem like harmless fun, but -- excuse me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But they took it --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, they took it down, but I want to know who the person who was writing that, like everyone thinks this is fine. Who?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Good point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a very good point. So they delete it, no one gets punished.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: He should get -- I'm sorry, but someone might be inviting that person to a party.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: The holidays will be here before you know it. I do not want that at my Christmas party.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. Nope. Tyrus?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Close out this segment with your wisdom.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I have to laugh at the way the world has turned on white men in this country.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not this again.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: What? I can't enjoy this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Okay, go ahead. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It used to be our thing that we'd be arrested for crimes we didn't commit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: We know you did something. Book him. You assaulted someone even though there's no one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Good enough for us. Like, I feel bad -- how does it feel, fellas? Sorry, it's really -- and you're laughing because that's where we're at right now. Old white men. Absolutely with two eyes open. Now every time they hear the police, they wonder what they did. Just like that.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It's really nice, it's really great. Progress.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, at least he sees us --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: All white guys are mad about it, but it's true. Did they not just make up a crime a white man didn't come close to committing?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Sure.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: So you know, keep it in your pants, fellas. You stay on board.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: They issued a correction.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They issued a correction. I think "The New York Times" should just have a separate issue called "The Correction." Before we go, an update on "The Gutfeld Monologues" live, fall tour. We've added a new show in Cleveland on December 7th. Next show October 12th at Omaha. We're also headed to Jacksonville Durham -- Durham? Durham and Knoxville ggutfeld.com for ticket info. Coming up. So how weak are the Democratic candidates. We discuss, you imbibe.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: “The Greg Gutfeld Show” presents the 2020 CAN'T-idates.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He may be first on the path, but he can't do math. Joe Biden's got a child tax credit plan he wants you to know about and it goes something like this.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: You get a tax break for a racehorse, why in God's name couldn't we provide an $8,000.00 tax credit for everybody who has childcare costs?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait, I can get a tax credit for a racehorse?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But tell me, Joe, how many women would put back in the workforce?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: It would 720 million back -- million women back in the workforce.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wow. 720 million women. That's amazing. Out of a total U.S. population of 320 million men and women. He is going to put 720 million women back to work. That would be impressive and impossible. Speaking of numbers, the latest poll from a place called Fox News shows 46 percent of voters think Trump will be reelected --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hold on, hold on. Back in December, over half thought he would. But back then, we didn't know it would be this lot trying to run against Trump. Who knew the race for the nomination would look like this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: In fairness, I do that, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Meanwhile, British a betting site is taking wagers on who will be the nominee and more bets are on Hillary than any of the other candidates. Her odds are 20 to one or in Biden math, gazillions of banana face.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So it's not surprising that 38 percent say they're hoping someone new enters the race. So who would have the stuff to win? Well, not him. He dropped out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How did Trump take it?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Too bad, he had tremendous potential. He only had one real asset. You know what it was? Height.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Height. Height, Heather, that was the only advantage. I'll never be President. So how do you feel about this?

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: You wear heels.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I do wear heels? Usually downtown on a Saturday night. You can find me in the park, walking my imaginary dog.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Not that there's anything wrong with that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There is nothing wrong with it. You know. Thank you, Kat. Heather, what's your take on this week with the candidates? Any thoughts?

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: Well, as someone who talks about the economy a lot, I'd start with Joe Biden's 720 million workers back into the workforce that are women. So I'm trying to think how can we get there? Yes, it would be more than double the U.S. population. The unemployment rate is already at 50-year lows, but I'm thinking, maybe since Democrats most of them are in favor of open borders, you bring in about 600 million in from overseas to the U.S. and that's how you get to the 720 million American women.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Problem solved.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Maybe, but I don't really think that's a bad thing, Kat?

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: Open borders?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I just feel honestly really bad for Joe Biden at this point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: To be honest with you. Because the statistic that stuck out to me the most was that 36 percent of the people that support Joe Biden are among those who are hoping someone else enters the race.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Like, that's like finding out the person you are dating still has a Tinder account. Right? Like, that's a hard thing to face. Like he is thinking that all these people think he is Mr. Right. And they actually think he's Mr. All right for now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That's always hard to deal with.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I mean, if your supporters --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Would wait for somebody better.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, your supporters are like still, you know, going out on dates with other people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's every relationship in your 20s.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Oh, so it's not wasn't just mine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, no. Yes. Especially in New York City.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's the city. It wasn't me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it wasn't you at all. You're a prize, Kat, a prize.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: A gem, you might say.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're a gem.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: National treasure, if you will.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A diamond in the rough. A diamond in the rough.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I'd go with national treasure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A needle in the haystack. Tyrus, the entire field right now, it's like a lousy episode of "The Love Boat." No big names, just aging dull mediocrities. You know, bellowing platitudes, maybe. What you're going to just --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: So you got cheated on a lot when you're in your 20s?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I'd say a fair amount. Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Any of those guys feel like running for President for the Democratic Party? You want to reach out to them.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: They are all unemployed, so it could be.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: You know, I don't know how the rest of the panel can look themselves in the mirror. Now, I get it. Joe Biden is old. Worse than that, he is old and white.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There we go.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I get it. I get it. There's a new -- they're the bad guys. You can go watch them. They're everywhere. They're tricksters. And his little buddy, Bernie. Plotting to put soup in everyone's household. Not on my watch.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I love soup in --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: As bad as he is, as bad as every -- he starts out great. Like his team must be like, oh, we're doing great. He talked about getting jobs and tax credit. He was kind of witty with the whole -- you can get a tax credit for racehorse, you damn well should get a tax break if you have children, and we have 700 -- oh, like they are -- They just need a smoke bomb and a dance team to come out. Just get him out of there. But having said of all that, as bad as he is. He is whooping the rest of you all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: So bad. How can you run -- like if I was on -- was competing for a job.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: And it was a dance contest. And the guy that kept taking falls every time during the dance number. And they're still picking him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. That says something.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Last word, Terry.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: I think it was kind of obvious right from the jump that Biden was done. I mean, you know, President Obama said he is the best Vice President you could have had. He has never endorsed him. He is never coming --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: I mean, like that says a lot, not about Biden, but also about President Obama and his loyalty because he is either lying or he is hiding something. By the way, those numbers that Biden gave, it could possibly work out if all the lazy women in this country got two jobs.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Yes, you were all thinking it. You were all thinking it.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: The unemployment rate in each person --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I do have two jobs, you [bleep].

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Not enough. Not enough.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait, you have two jobs, Kat?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So you're stealing jobs from another woman?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: How dare you? That's racist.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: The 720 million that don't have one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I am outraged.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I'm going to get five jobs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And I am not sure about what, but I am outraged.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.sentences: Me, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. We're going to take this outrage to the next segment, the wokest politician on the planet is addicted to shoe polish. That's next.

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. The death toll is rising to five in Texas now following the torrential rain earlier this week from tropical storm Imelda. The rising floodwaters began to recede on Friday. Many residents say the damage left behind is eerily similar to that of Hurricane Harvey two years ago. Rescue crews have been going door-to-door to help those who remain trapped in their homes. Meantime, young activists were out again today, just one day after the Global Climate Strike. They took their message from the streets straight to the United Nations. Sixteen-year-old Swedish activist, Greta Thunberg spoke at the event urging world leaders to act on climate change. Friday's global protests attracting millions from across the country and around the world. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to “The Greg Gutfeld Show.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is there any going back after painting your face black? By now you've seen pictures of Justin Trudeau wearing brown face, a new phrase back in 2001, and also in high school singing the banana boat song in blackface. And then a third instance of black face sometime in the 90s. All coming to light a month before and election, so I wonder if Trudeau is sorry.

utterances.speaker: JUSTIN TRUDEAU, CANADIAN PRIME MINISTER

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Terry Schappert, Heather Zumarraga, Kat Timpf, Tyrus, and our studio audience. I'm Greg Gutfeld and I love you America.
