utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: We're going to Mars. We're stopping at the moon. The moon is actually a launching pad. That's why we're stopping at the moon. I said, hey, we've already done the moon. That's so exciting. And I said, sir, I said, I want you to head for Mars. So we'll be doing the moon, but we will really be doing Mars.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: I could see it now. Mars-a-Lago.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, it's been another banner week for the media -- by banner, you mean stupid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They remind me of a nasty fly.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Every major-- that's a nasty fly. I don't like those suckers. I don't know about you in New Mexico, but I'm not into flies or mosquitoes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But who is really? Also, you know, I don't like snakes too much.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I don't like snakes too much. We have plenty of them in New York and Washington, a different variety. I don't like snakes either.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what? They're almost as bad as children.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I know a guy who can't stand his children. They are horrible, horrible human beings. They're a little older now. But they're horrible human beings. He wants to leave his well. They said why would you leave them? They don't even like you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Makes me think of the song "YMCA."

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Think of the song, "YMCA." Y-M-C-A. Think of the song.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We are, Mr. President, and why not? Everyone loves that song.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: The Republicans love it. And the Democrats love it. And frankly, labor loves it. Unions love it. Farmers love, love, love it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Which could be why everyone is looking so much better these days.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: You look all much better than you did three years ago, even with the #MeToo Movement, we can't say this. But I'll say it anyway, you're better looking. Including the men.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Including the men, Terry. Not like those phony Democrats.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: How about these phony Democrats? They started with Russia, Russia, Russia. Then they went to race. Do you believe that one? Race? Then they went to recession. There is going to be a recession. Oh, please let there be a recession. Please.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: These are phony people. But that's okay.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: These are phony people. But that's okay. You know, when you think of it, I'm President and they're not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you very much, President Trump.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Thank you very much, President Trump. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was an experiment to show you that [bleep] this is funny on its own. I don't even have to write a damn joke anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just pick the best parts and repeat it. Which is great. It's less work for me. And he is way more entertaining than his critics in the media, who are getting more desperate every day. Things are pretty good, but they need people to believe it's pretty bad. So what did they do? They frantically try to reanimate the Kavanaugh story, right? "The New York Times" ran an excerpt from a book in which an alleged incident of sexual abuse was documented. And then it was on every show and every network until, whoops, it was revealed at "The Times," you know, they left out a key fact. The alleged victim had no recollection of any incident -- at all. Weird how that detail got past the editors? You'd think a detail like that would matter. But they knew the book and the story itself was a dud. So they obliterated that detail. And that was how they maintained their business model, which is to sell urban legends to people who feel the same way they do. So they ran a story about a Supreme Court Justice committing a crime, leaving out the part about there not being a victim. Imagine that. That's a pretty big omission. I mean, that's like writing a book about great Americans and forgetting about me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, thank you. Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But that wasn't the only mistake the media made this week. One day, they're pushing false stats on hate crimes linking them to Trump rallies, which was then debunked by "Reason" magazine. Then on another day, they're running stories about Trump stealing pancakes in Scotland. I'm not kidding. That was an actual story. There was other crap too about Trump's family turmoil, but it all burned briefly and faded. No wonder the media tried to revive the Kavanaugh smear. And as always, in trying to take down Trump, they deliberately warp the truth. I wonder if Trump agrees that this is one of the worst weeks in the history of the fake news media.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I think this is one of the worst weeks in the history of the fake news media. The media of our country is laughed at all over the world now. You're a joke.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're a joke. Ouch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So it is getting harder and harder each day to figure out what's real and what isn't out there in media land. If only there was a product for that.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: It's happening everywhere. In parks, in offices, and in homes all across America.

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, FOX NATION HOST
utterances.utterance: This is awful. Every time I read "The Times," I realize it's wrong or they've left out facts, then I have to waste time rereading the corrections. And I'm a centrist. It's ridiculous, and exhausting.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: It sounds like you could use some Correction Lenses.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: At this point, I'm going for anything. What are they?

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Correction lenses are an ocular enhancement that prevents your eyes from seeing all the inaccuracies in "The New York Times" reporting by removing everything except the truth. The result? You get only the facts.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Whoa. This is incredible. It's only the truth stuff. It is September 2019. And look, here is the word the, T-H-E. That's how you spell it. This is amazing. Do they work on anything else?

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Sure thing. Try watching CNN. That's right. Correction Lenses turn all CNN programming into "Tucker Carlson Tonight."

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Wow. This is the best invention ever. Thanks, Correction Lenses.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: So get Correction Lenses today. It's for people who love news, real news.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: It makes up for the fact that my wife won't talk to me.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's welcome tonight's guests. If GI Joe and Popeye had a love child, yes, it would be retired Green Beret Master Sergeant Terry Schappert.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She is always sunny and knows a lot about money, stock market guru and financial analyst, Heather Zumarraga.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She is small in stature, but sounds like Thatcher. Host of "Sincerely, Kat" on Fox Nation, Kat Timpf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And one day, he accidentally tripped on Guam. My massive sidekick and host of "Nuff Said" on Fox Nation, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Terry, Terry, so what do you make of the media performance this week?

utterances.speaker: TERRY SCHAPPERT, RETIRED GREEN BERET MASTER SERGEANT
utterances.utterance: Here's the problem. Trump is making you comedically lazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: You're getting comedically flabby because you don't have to write anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is true.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: And you know, I wish you'd put a little more effort, but you don't have to.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's so obvious that I didn't do the work this week.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because okay A, I had jury duty.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: You were busy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was in jury duty. I was sitting there for hours and then I was reading the transcript of Trumps words. I go, thank you.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: He gave it to you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He gave it to me.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I just don't want you to lose the eye of the tiger, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I won't.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Okay, good. Also speaking of eyes, the glasses that's from my favorite movie, one of them, "They Live."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "They Live."

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: It never gets old. The media. Here's the thing, I heard a guy call on the radio other day on a show. I am not going say his name because he was a conservative thinker. And he said, you know, the problem is the media continues to bite on this. No, they're not biting on anything. They're creating it. Right? So I mean, and the thing is, they've just been busted. I still don't think they can recover from this. They just don't stop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you know what the thing is Heather, it's like I think the media has created a permanent jaded public. They're like a cheating spouse, you no longer buy their BS, right? Not that I would know. These are only analogies, people. Only analogies, Heather.

utterances.speaker: HEATHER ZUMARRAGA, FINANCIAL ANALYST
utterances.utterance: What did they think? Oops, that's a big oops that they forgot. Miss Ramirez didn't even -- wasn't even interviewed and the supposed witness, Max Stier doesn't even recall the incident. Says she doesn't even recall the incident that they're attacking Judge Kavanaugh on? That's more than an oops. So they made a retraction. I get it. They made the correction. But three Democratic Presidential candidates immediately, Senator Warren, Senator Harris, Beto O'Rourke immediately called for Kavanaugh's resignation. There's a problem with that. That's just wrong.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. And then of course --

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: They didn't even verify any facts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. And you know what, Kat? Nobody gets punished. Like is "New York Times" going to do anything about it? No, they just -- they let it move on until they find the next crisis which is the Ukrainian phone call, I guess.

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NATION HOST
utterances.utterance: Look, I mean, they issued a correction, all right.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Corrections can be very useful for things like we said that Bob was 41, he is really 42 or like we said that Sarah was from San Diego. She is really from San Jose. Or the woman who was allegedly assaulted does not remember, you know, saying -- no, obviously, using a correction for selling that -- however, I would like to shame "The New York Times" for something related.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And I have the receipts here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I will -- because you didn't touch on it. Maybe if you've been working a little harder you would have touched on this.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: He is lazy.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: But did you see the tweet? GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, CONTRIBUTOR: The man was in jury duty.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: This is the tweet that "The New York Times" tweeted out ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: ... to promote this story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: It said, having a [bleep] thrust in your face at a drunken dorm party may seem like harmless fun, but -- excuse me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But they took it --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, they took it down, but I want to know who the person who was writing that, like everyone thinks this is fine. Who?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Good point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a very good point. So they delete it, no one gets punished.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: He should get -- I'm sorry, but someone might be inviting that person to a party.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: The holidays will be here before you know it. I do not want that at my Christmas party.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. Nope. Tyrus?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Close out this segment with your wisdom.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I have to laugh at the way the world has turned on white men in this country.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Not this again.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: What? I can't enjoy this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay, go ahead. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It used to be our thing that we'd be arrested for crimes we didn't commit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: We know you did something. Book him. You assaulted someone even though there's no one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Good enough for us. Like, I feel bad -- how does it feel, fellas? Sorry, it's really -- and you're laughing because that's where we're at right now. Old white men. Absolutely with two eyes open. Now every time they hear the police, they wonder what they did. Just like that.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It's really nice, it's really great. Progress.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, at least he sees us --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: All white guys are mad about it, but it's true. Did they not just make up a crime a white man didn't come close to committing?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Sure.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So you know, keep it in your pants, fellas. You stay on board.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: They issued a correction.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They issued a correction. I think "The New York Times" should just have a separate issue called "The Correction." Before we go, an update on "The Gutfeld Monologues" live, fall tour. We've added a new show in Cleveland on December 7th. Next show October 12th at Omaha. We're also headed to Jacksonville Durham -- Durham? Durham and Knoxville ggutfeld.com for ticket info. Coming up. So how weak are the Democratic candidates. We discuss, you imbibe.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: “The Greg Gutfeld Show” presents the 2020 CAN'T-idates.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He may be first on the path, but he can't do math. Joe Biden's got a child tax credit plan he wants you to know about and it goes something like this.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: You get a tax break for a racehorse, why in God's name couldn't we provide an $8,000.00 tax credit for everybody who has childcare costs?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait, I can get a tax credit for a racehorse?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But tell me, Joe, how many women would put back in the workforce?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: It would 720 million back -- million women back in the workforce.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wow. 720 million women. That's amazing. Out of a total U.S. population of 320 million men and women. He is going to put 720 million women back to work. That would be impressive and impossible. Speaking of numbers, the latest poll from a place called Fox News shows 46 percent of voters think Trump will be reelected --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hold on, hold on. Back in December, over half thought he would. But back then, we didn't know it would be this lot trying to run against Trump. Who knew the race for the nomination would look like this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: In fairness, I do that, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Meanwhile, British a betting site is taking wagers on who will be the nominee and more bets are on Hillary than any of the other candidates. Her odds are 20 to one or in Biden math, gazillions of banana face.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So it's not surprising that 38 percent say they're hoping someone new enters the race. So who would have the stuff to win? Well, not him. He dropped out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How did Trump take it?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Too bad, he had tremendous potential. He only had one real asset. You know what it was? Height.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Height. Height, Heather, that was the only advantage. I'll never be President. So how do you feel about this?

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: You wear heels.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I do wear heels? Usually downtown on a Saturday night. You can find me in the park, walking my imaginary dog.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Not that there's anything wrong with that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is nothing wrong with it. You know. Thank you, Kat. Heather, what's your take on this week with the candidates? Any thoughts?

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: Well, as someone who talks about the economy a lot, I'd start with Joe Biden's 720 million workers back into the workforce that are women. So I'm trying to think how can we get there? Yes, it would be more than double the U.S. population. The unemployment rate is already at 50-year lows, but I'm thinking, maybe since Democrats most of them are in favor of open borders, you bring in about 600 million in from overseas to the U.S. and that's how you get to the 720 million American women.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Problem solved.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Maybe, but I don't really think that's a bad thing, Kat?

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: Open borders?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I just feel honestly really bad for Joe Biden at this point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: To be honest with you. Because the statistic that stuck out to me the most was that 36 percent of the people that support Joe Biden are among those who are hoping someone else enters the race.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Like, that's like finding out the person you are dating still has a Tinder account. Right? Like, that's a hard thing to face. Like he is thinking that all these people think he is Mr. Right. And they actually think he's Mr. All right for now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That's always hard to deal with.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I mean, if your supporters --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Would wait for somebody better.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, your supporters are like still, you know, going out on dates with other people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's every relationship in your 20s.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Oh, so it's not wasn't just mine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, no. Yes. Especially in New York City.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's the city. It wasn't me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it wasn't you at all. You're a prize, Kat, a prize.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: A gem, you might say.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're a gem.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: National treasure, if you will.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A diamond in the rough. A diamond in the rough.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I'd go with national treasure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A needle in the haystack. Tyrus, the entire field right now, it's like a lousy episode of "The Love Boat." No big names, just aging dull mediocrities. You know, bellowing platitudes, maybe. What you're going to just --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So you got cheated on a lot when you're in your 20s?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I'd say a fair amount. Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Any of those guys feel like running for President for the Democratic Party? You want to reach out to them.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: They are all unemployed, so it could be.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You know, I don't know how the rest of the panel can look themselves in the mirror. Now, I get it. Joe Biden is old. Worse than that, he is old and white.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There we go.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I get it. I get it. There's a new -- they're the bad guys. You can go watch them. They're everywhere. They're tricksters. And his little buddy, Bernie. Plotting to put soup in everyone's household. Not on my watch.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I love soup in --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: As bad as he is, as bad as every -- he starts out great. Like his team must be like, oh, we're doing great. He talked about getting jobs and tax credit. He was kind of witty with the whole -- you can get a tax credit for racehorse, you damn well should get a tax break if you have children, and we have 700 -- oh, like they are -- They just need a smoke bomb and a dance team to come out. Just get him out of there. But having said of all that, as bad as he is. He is whooping the rest of you all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So bad. How can you run -- like if I was on -- was competing for a job.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And it was a dance contest. And the guy that kept taking falls every time during the dance number. And they're still picking him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. That says something.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Last word, Terry.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I think it was kind of obvious right from the jump that Biden was done. I mean, you know, President Obama said he is the best Vice President you could have had. He has never endorsed him. He is never coming --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I mean, like that says a lot, not about Biden, but also about President Obama and his loyalty because he is either lying or he is hiding something. By the way, those numbers that Biden gave, it could possibly work out if all the lazy women in this country got two jobs.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes, you were all thinking it. You were all thinking it.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: The unemployment rate in each person --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I do have two jobs, you [bleep].

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Not enough. Not enough.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait, you have two jobs, Kat?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So you're stealing jobs from another woman?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: How dare you? That's racist.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: The 720 million that don't have one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I am outraged.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I'm going to get five jobs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And I am not sure about what, but I am outraged.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Me, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. We're going to take this outrage to the next segment, the wokest politician on the planet is addicted to shoe polish. That's next.

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. The death toll is rising to five in Texas now following the torrential rain earlier this week from tropical storm Imelda. The rising floodwaters began to recede on Friday. Many residents say the damage left behind is eerily similar to that of Hurricane Harvey two years ago. Rescue crews have been going door-to-door to help those who remain trapped in their homes. Meantime, young activists were out again today, just one day after the Global Climate Strike. They took their message from the streets straight to the United Nations. Sixteen-year-old Swedish activist, Greta Thunberg spoke at the event urging world leaders to act on climate change. Friday's global protests attracting millions from across the country and around the world. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to “The Greg Gutfeld Show.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is there any going back after painting your face black? By now you've seen pictures of Justin Trudeau wearing brown face, a new phrase back in 2001, and also in high school singing the banana boat song in blackface. And then a third instance of black face sometime in the 90s. All coming to light a month before and election, so I wonder if Trudeau is sorry.

utterances.speaker: JUSTIN TRUDEAU, CANADIAN PRIME MINISTER
utterances.utterance: I'm really sorry. This is something that I deeply, deeply regret. I didn't see that from the layers of privilege that I have, and for that I am deeply sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Deeply. Sounds sincere. No one in his party is calling for his resignation, and let's face it, the media only really cares about this stuff when a non-liberal pulls this kind of crap. But it raises one question. Why is it always the wokest guy in the room who has the most to hide? Could there be a connection there? Meanwhile, there was one question that media kept asking.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.utterance: Mr. Trudeau how many times? Is it just the three that we know about or are there more incidents because you know people are looking for them?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait. Is three not enough? Asking if there are more incidents then quote, "just the three" seems to imply there's like an acceptable amount. Three, well, okay, but there better not be four. Three and a half. Anyway, Trudeau didn't say whether there were more, but he did say this in French.

utterances.speaker: TRUDEAU
utterances.utterance: (Speaking in foreign language).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I'm very sorry for what I've done. But I'm not very sorry that every Saturday night at 10:00 p.m. I watch “The Greg Gutfeld Show” on Fox News Channel.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All is forgiven. All is forgiven. All right, Tyrus, lay the truth on me about the white guy. He is Canadian, too. He is a white Canadian.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I know it's really --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A rich, privileged white Canadian.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: A rich guy who --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Famous parents.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Famous parents.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Very liberal progressive.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Okay --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Very woke.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Look, you're stonewalling. You're so afraid what the black man is about to tell you about yourself, America?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Let me tell you what I think.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Give it to me.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I don't care. It was 20 years ago. He did some dumb stuff 20 years ago. Now, if when his first day he was elected, he came out in brown face and said, my first act is to get anyone like this out. Problem. That's racist. He did some dumb stuff. I myself did some racist things about 10 years ago, 15 years ago, when I got pulled over by the police. I would turn my head around forward, turn on country music and say, good evening, officer, I didn't know I was driving that far. I am very sorry. I did -- but first, I pretended to have a white voice to calm the officer down. I was in school in Nebraska. I got -- my buddy got pulled over and he was white. And he was like, I didn't know I couldn't do that. And I sat in the seat going, you've got to teach me that magic, bro. Because that's not how where I come from. I used that. I'm sorry, America, I pretended to have a white voice and dialect. Taking advantage on police officers. Let the boycotts begin now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cultural appropriation. Kat, I have a sound defense for him. The only explanation as to why he did it three times is because he didn't know it was racist. And if he didn't know, he is not racist, he is just stupid. Which is, you know, not racist, but stupid.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: See, I want to offer a take on this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I know that it's my job. But I just feel intimidated because I don't think I could offer as impressive of a take as Don Lemon did over at CNN. He said multiple times. Well, but isn't it nice to see a leader apologize?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Isn't it nice to see your leader apologize. Clearly taking a dig at President Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I just don't understand. I mean, the fact that he was able to take a story about Justin Trudeau wearing brown face and turn it into an opportunity to talk smack about President Trump. I mean, that's like a kind of gymnastics we have not even seen from Simone Biles. That is impressive.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That is impressive. He sees this story about the Canadian Prime Minister wearing brown face, and his reaction is, oh, I can't believe that Trump guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Because it's not really that offensive. And it's selective shock to racism because I guarantee you if that would have been I don't know, a Republican senator who did that. I guarantee you his tune wouldn't be that. He would be screaming. It would be 15 minutes of silence --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He would be making lemonade.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Justin Trudeau is so insufferable. Do you remember when that woman, he corrected her and he said, don't say mankind, say people kind. Meanwhile, he's got like a black face thing like, come on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, he's got problems. Heather, the media would be more outraged if a Republican or a conservative did it. I think they were actually more offended that Trump has an orange face.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right? He has got an orange face.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: He admitted it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He admitted he had an orange face.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: No, definitely. The statement that Don Lemon made, if that was a Republican, blood would be drawn, knives would be out. It's a complete double standard. It's hypocrisy and I appreciate everything Tyrus says whether or not it's seen as racist, or is now or was 20 years ago. The point is that the liberals have made that a rule, even Trudeau himself came out and said that wearing blackface, putting dark makeup on your face is racist. But then he had done it himself. Not one time, maybe that could be excused. Many times, we don't know how many times.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That's probably how he still sleeps at night.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There's a joke there. You know what it is though, Terry, it's about hypocrisy in the sense that everybody here will forgive. We forgive. But I don't think anybody there on that other ideological side or the other side politics would forgive you or Kat or Tyrus --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I wear it every day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't see skin color.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I was glad when I was growing up that pretty much only like Polaroids and normal pictures, because that's gone. And the thing is with the black face, you're right, the phrase I used to say in the military all the time is like you rig it, you ride it, Ranger. You know that's your parachute, you want to ride like that. That is on you. They've created the rules. They've created the rules in a way -- I am with Tyrus, man. I don't care if you -- I don't care if you make fun of my white voice. I don't care. And Tyrus doesn't care if I were blackface, I suspect.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: A little bit.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: And by the way, as soon as I said that, I went, eh, he probably does care a little bit. But the point is this kind of stuff has got to go away because, man, I mean, we are very forgiving. But we've never --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They won't forgive us for anything.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: They've never -- they don't play fair.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But one word, if we screwed up one word, they would be marching on us. You know, and I go back to that point. It's always the wokest guy in the room that has the most to hide.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That can't be a coincidence. All right. Coming up. Brats use climate change to take off school. Can't say I blame them, a bunch of brats.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're allowed to skip school as an activist tool. New York City public schools allowed students to participate in Friday's Global Climate Strike marches during school hours without penalty, meaning 1.1 million kids were exempt from class or as Biden might say, 12.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Any kid -- any kid that wants to skip out the protest needs parental consent, which means any kid who doesn't get permission has to stay in school so they could be laughed at while resenting the responsible parents. Now, this climate change protests were planned nationwide. But not all school districts are excusing the absence. And believe it or not, some parents in New York would rather they instill the values. Thank you. One of them told "The Post" quote, "I am all for people supporting causes they believe in, but do not force your causes and beliefs on my first grader."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I remember -- I remember skipping school. It looked like this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I have no idea what I was protesting. But that was beautiful. All right, Kat, what are your thoughts on this protest?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Well, first of all, I just want to say I love the planet.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I think I might even be biased towards the planet because I have lived here literally my whole life.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, Yes. You have. Literally.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I don't know where I'd move.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: But at the same time, I always think that kids should be allowed to be excused for activism. My issue is that that's not what the school was doing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: They weren't saying, you are excused to go protest for a cause that you're passionate about. They're saying, we're passionate about this one. So you're free to go march in the streets for us.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: These kids are not like free workers for you. They are children.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: So don't pick and choose like that don't -- because then the kid is not going to be allowed to go or who doesn't want to go, like that would have been me because I never wanted to miss school because I was like, I know, I'll never have a career if I miss first grade. And I was a little neurotic. And then everyone would have made fun of me. And like, they were already making fun of me so much for my like she mullet, that I don't think I could have handled it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Thinking about a she mullet right now and it's making me --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That was my intention.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Heather. This also paints a scarlet letter on kids who still show up for school or the parents who object to the political act --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And kids with mullets.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kids with -- and I think activists know that the peer pressure works in their favor, and they don't care. They'll torment these kids.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: No exactly. It's gone too far. I mean, I'm not saying that I'm not in favor of reducing some of the impacts of whatever you want to advocate --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Do you live here to?

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: No, that's the thing is that I'm so happy. I don't and that my daughter goes to a public school in a different state because I would be infuriated and outraged as a mother, one elementary school in New York, actually mailed a letter home to the parents saying that don't come to school or come to school, but everybody's going to be gone because we all will be at the protest. And I don't mind if you want to go. Do it on the weekend. The Department of Education.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because that means --

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: Mayor Bill de Blasio?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That means you actually sacrificed something. If you do it on the weekend.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: Do it on a weekend.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is a free -- this is a freebie.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: They can't pressure you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a freebie. And you know what, the activists know that kids are great political weapons. They're easy to bribe --

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: And you can't go after them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They get a day off school. And if you actually criticize the kids, they accuse you of punching down. You're not. You're punching up because they are being used as political tools.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Same with the Scandinavian girl that --

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I was going to say, you know, I want to talk before Tyrus goes in with these long pregnant pauses and shows us how smart he is, so here is the thing.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You hear that ladies?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes, they got that. So here's the thing. If you noticed, this is the small kids stuff. When Kavanaugh was getting hammered. He went to Harvard, Harvard law students, the best, you pay a lot of money to go to Harvard Law. They walked out of class because he is a rapist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: You're a frickin' lawyer. You're supposed to be a law student. This is how indoctrinated they are by design.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: So you start with these little kids. And now you have law students at probably the most prestigious place. They walked out because he is a rapist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I'm sorry, Tyrus. You can continue with it. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes. I'd love to piggyback off of that. What are you, crazy? We are talking about kids going off for the day for activism. And you took us there. All right, cool. Let me get out my broom and a cold shower and figure this out.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Here comes the pause.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Here's my issue with climate control, when you talk about these things, because it's a global problem, which means it's unattainable for us, Americans to fix what other countries do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: China was not doing anything. Actually --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So what ends up happening was when I was a kid, when we want to do things for our environment, it was tangible. Our school had Arbor Day where they came in and they said, here's a free tree, go plant it somewhere and watch it grow. And you're helping the environment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And so then we all took our little trees, and we were so smart. And we're planting them. We're like, we're helping the environment. And then we were educating, hey, trees create oxygen, so I'm going to be better around trees. I'm not going to vandalize trees. Then there was this awesome thing called, hey, kids, aerosol cans bad for the thing. So guess what, we got away with weird hairdos and stuff because aerosol was bad. And then then they had another drive where it was, hey, recycle, put the plastics and this one and that and Americans got behind it. And we made our place. We made our country better because it was attainable goals. And all of these things, you take those kids that went there today. They come back to school tomorrow. Okay, what did you learn? What are you going to learn differently?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes. Right on. Nothing.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Because it's about a political statement.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Not teaching them anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Nicely summarized by Tyrus. Up next, he was about to get fired, so he brought a clown for support. Not me, I was busy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When your job is going down, send in the clown. An ad man from New Zealand -- they have them there, Terry -- named Joshua Jack -- great mustache -- was recently called into a work meeting and feared the worst that he was getting fired. So he hired an emotional support clown to join him. Apparently companies in New Zealand are legally required to offer employees a chance to bring a support person to help cushion the blow of getting canned. Amazing. So it turns out he was right, he did get fired, but having the clown made it not so bad. So Jack, it was sort of no noisy him making balloon animals. So we did have to tell them to be quiet from time to time. Now, the clown cost 200 bucks. Or as Joe Biden says gurgle burgle, moo, moo, boop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I am going to milk that joke the whole year. Some work, Jack has already landed another job. Meanwhile, the clown also got a new job as a piano player.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Heather. Why isn't this shocking? Isn't this the direction of the world? You just take a support person everywhere or anywhere --

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: No, or an animal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: A dog.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: Some planes are seeing ostriches, different types of animals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But into work meetings now. Do you know that I was at a meeting years ago when somebody brought their parents to a job review?

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, because he thought he was getting fired.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: Well, and he probably got fired anyway.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He did.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: Just like this guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We had to change the locks to the place.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: Well, and your $200.00 out of pocket. It was a huge workplace distraction. I mean, they said that the balloon animals were causing so much noise in the office. They had to tell the clown to tone it down a little bit. But the fact that the workplace -- your place of work still allowed you to bring in a clown with you. That's pretty cool.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Tyrus, what do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You know what, man?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Clown face. He is like clown face.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: He didn't. He didn't. White people are great, man. You guys are so ingenious when it comes to lose a job and stuff. We're not signing anything and we're not coming in. If you tell me, hey, Tyrus, you mind coming in next Thursday a little early. I am not coming.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I know what's about to happen. I get water at the water cooler, too. Hell no, I ain't in. You can tell me what you need to tell me now. I ain't flying all the way in to get fired. But I don't want to -- it was an ad agency.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: How do you not get promoted?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I mean, he literally brought a clown in and gave them a sales pitch.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes, you're right, man.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Like, instead of firing me, watch this clown. I mean, like, for some reason I'm watching this clown. This guy is great. He is really suggestive. Yes, he could work with cars. Hey, come down and watch us make balloon animals and by far that's what he has done. Like this ad agency --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, it's actually -- it was genius, Terry.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I was laughing the whole time. This guy is legend.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Bringing a clown.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I mean, you know I have some of my buddies from the military that, you know they have service dogs and it's really helped their lives, but everybody ruins it. People abuse it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The first you bring in a new thing, people abuse it.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think also probably --

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: Bringing a poodle on the plane with a red support dog banner around them is just not believable.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: There is a difference between support and service.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Poodles can be very emotional supportive.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's true. But I mean, look, if one of you like walked on a plane with like a support blow up doll. That would be weird. Like I am serious, life if you walked in and go --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay, Terry, I did that once.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: I knew it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You had to bring it up. We're editing it out.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: You know why I know it, because I bring this up because you -- you have done this to me all the time in our relationship and you hurt me in front of people and I'm getting you back. That's it. America, you know, he is a really mean person.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I only talk about your fashion sense, and I like to see you've toned it down a bit. You must be in a relationship.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Oh, you stole his joke. You stole it. He stole it. A white guy stole your joke.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: No. We joke together, we're a team.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Because you know. But it's true. I've been meaning, you used to wear like fancy pants, like skinny bell bottoms.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: And I will again, but I am not a performing monkey.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: No, because you're happy.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And you're letting your hair grow out.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You are tight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He is putting on some weight. He is putting on some weight.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It's happy weight.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: That's also not true. That is not true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, pretty soon, you're going to be like --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: He is not saying it's not true.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: I am shattering expectations. Every time I come on to this show.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: He put make up on, I saw him back there --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Let me get Kat in here. We veered off into let's make fun of Terry land.

utterances.speaker: SCHAPPERT
utterances.utterance: Oh, who is Kat? Oh, what have you got? Greg made fun of me?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: So I would just like to say, I respect this. Do not understand it. No offense to clowns. And no offense to the guy who was in clown college when we were dating in 2012, Brian, if you're watching this, don't take it personally.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You literally dated a bunch of clowns.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: No, Clown College. He was in Clown, so he was a student clown.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Got you. Got you.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Brian, not about you. But I have never been in any situation and thought, you know, what would make this better? A clown?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Like, especially not -- if I'm getting fired, I don't want to be around bright colors and dancing and balloon animals. I want to bring somebody who was in a worse situation than me. Like, don't give me the clown. Give me the chick who just got served divorce papers, and it's like her sixth one. And she is only 25 and also her house just burned down and her safe was in there full of money and she's over here blubbering. Give me that chick.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.
